text.0: the goldhued juice poured out upon the filter is started like a car sent forth to conquer.
text.1: he hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him and hath rejoiced the gods with entertainments.
text.2: he who beholdeth man hath reached the filter bearing his name the sage hath sought his dwelling.
text.3: the Ṛṣis came to him seven holy singers when in the bowls he settled as invoker.
text.4: shared by all gods mobt wise propitious soma goes while they cleanse him to his constant station.
text.5: let him rejoice in all his lofty wisdom to the five tribes the sage attains with labour.
text.6: in thy mysterious place o pavamana soma are all the gods the thriceeleven.
text.7: ten on the fleecy height themselves selfprompted and seven fresh rivers brighten and adorn thee.
text.8: now let this be the truth of pavamana there where all singers gather them together.
text.9: that he hath given us room and made the daylight hath holpen manu and repelled the dasyu.
text.10: as the priest seeks the station rich in cattle like a true king who goes to great assemblies.
text.11: soma hath sought the beakers while they cleansed him and like a wild bull in the wood hath settled.
